intro: Marsdenia mollissima, commonly known as the silky Marsdenia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its soft, velvety leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It is often found growing in shaded, moist environments such as forests and rocky areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
